title: How to Make Cheese Free Quesadillas

steps.headline: Put the chickpeas into the blender or food processor.
Add the roasted capsicum, lemon juice, tahini, garlic and ground cumin.
Process the ingredients until smooth.
steps.description: This will take between one and two minutes.

steps.headline: Place a tortilla on a plate.
steps.description: Spread some of the blended chickpea mixture over the tortilla.

steps.headline: Put the filled tortilla into the frying pan (skillet).
Sprinkle some onions and tomatoes over the warming tortilla.
steps.description: Spread some salsa across the tortilla.

steps.headline: Add another tortilla to the top and keep warming until the base tortilla softens.
steps.description: Then flip over the tortilla to cook the other side until the other tortilla softens.

steps.headline: Remove the cooked tortilla from the pan.
steps.description: It's now a cheese-free "quesadilla" ready for serving – cut in half and serve.

steps.headline: Continue with the remaining tortillas until all have been cooked.
steps.description: Serve with a side of salad or as they are.

tyn: Knife to cut quesadillas in half
text: Put the chickpeas into the blender or food processor.  Add the roasted capsicum, lemon juice, tahini, garlic and ground cumin.  Process the ingredients until smooth. This will take between one and two minutes. Place a tortilla on a plate. Spread some of the blended chickpea mixture over the tortilla. Put the filled tortilla into the frying pan (skillet). Warm it over medium heat. Sprinkle some onions and tomatoes over the warming tortilla. Spread some salsa across the tortilla. Add another tortilla to the top and keep warming until the base tortilla softens. Then flip over the tortilla to cook the other side until the other tortilla softens. Remove the cooked tortilla from the pan. It's now a cheese-free "quesadilla" ready for serving – cut in half and serve. Continue with the remaining tortillas until all have been cooked. Serve with a side of salad or as they are.
sentences: Put the chickpeas into the blender or food processor.
Add the roasted capsicum, lemon juice, tahini, garlic and ground cumin.
This will take between one and two minutes.
Place a tortilla on a plate.
Spread some of the blended chickpea mixture over the tortilla.
Put the filled tortilla into the frying pan (skillet).
Sprinkle some onions and tomatoes over the warming tortilla.
Spread some salsa across the tortilla.
Add another tortilla to the top and keep warming until the base tortilla softens.
Then flip over the tortilla to cook the other side until the other tortilla softens.
Remove the cooked tortilla from the pan.
It's now a cheese-free "quesadilla" ready for serving – cut in half and serve.
Continue with the remaining tortillas until all have been cooked.
Serve with a side of salad or as they are.
